data.title: How to Watch the Orioles vs. Blue Jays Game: Streaming & TV Channel Info for August 7
data.meta_description: George Springer and the Toronto Blue Jays will hit the field on Wednesday at Rogers Centre against Trevor Rogers, who starts for the Baltimore Orioles. First pitch is at 7:07 PM ET. Watch MLB, other live sports and more on Fubo! Use our link to sign up for a free trial. Orioles vs. Blue Jays […]
data.text:
Published 7:06 am Wednesday, August 7, 2024

George Springer and the Toronto Blue Jays will hit the field on Wednesday at Rogers Centre against Trevor Rogers, who starts for the Baltimore Orioles. First pitch is at 7:07 PM ET.

Watch MLB, other live sports and more on Fubo! Use our link to sign up for a free trial.

Orioles vs. Blue Jays Live Stream, TV Channel and Game Info

Date: Wednesday, August 7, 2024

Time: 7:07 PM ET

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Venue: Rogers Centre

TV Channel: MASN2

Live Stream: Watch this game on Fubo

Email newsletter signup

Catch MLB action all season long on Fubo!.

Orioles Batting & Pitching Performance

The Baltimore Orioles lead the league with 175 total home runs, averaging 1.5 per game.

Baltimore leads MLB with a .452 slugging percentage this season, hammering out 399 extra-base hits.

The Orioles have the sixth-best batting average in the majors (.255).

Baltimore is the third-highest scoring team in MLB action, averaging 5.1 runs per game (578 total).

The Orioles are 10th in MLB with an on-base percentage of .319.

The Orioles strike out 8.2 times per game to rank 12th in baseball.

Baltimore has the 12th-ranked team ERA among all MLB pitching staffs (3.91).

Baltimore’s pitching staff ranks 15th in the majors with a collective 8.6 strikeouts per nine innings.

Pitchers for the Orioles combine for the 11th-ranked WHIP in the majors (1.231).

Place your bets on any MLB matchup at BetMGM, and sign up with our link for a first-time deposit bonus!

Orioles Probable Starting Pitcher

Rogers (2-10 with a 4.76 ERA and 88 strikeouts in 109 2/3 innings pitched) gets the start for the Orioles, his 23rd of the season.

In his last appearance on Thursday against the Cleveland Guardians, the left-hander went 4 1/3 innings, giving up five earned runs while surrendering six hits.

Rogers has three quality starts under his belt this season.

Rogers has put together 16 starts this campaign in which he pitched five or more innings.

He has made one appearance this season in which he did not surrender an earned run.
